ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English thogh, from Old English þéah. Cognate with German doch and Old Norse þó.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Conjunction (a word used to connect clauses or sentences or to coordinate words in the same clause)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Despite the fact that; although. Used to introduce a subordinate clause expressing contrast or concession.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 尽管；虽然。用于引导表示对比或让步的从句。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Though she was nervous, she performed brilliantly.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 尽管她很紧张，但她的表现非常出色。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Adverb (a word or phrase that modifies or qualifies an adjective, verb, or other adverb or a word group, expressing a relation of place, time, circumstance, manner, cause, degree, etc.)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: However; nevertheless; used to introduce a contrasting or qualifying statement, often placed at the end of a sentence or clause.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 不过；然而。用于句末，表示转折、限定或附加对比信息。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I don't think I'll be able to make it to the party; I appreciate the invitation, though.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我想我可能无法去参加派对了；不过，我很感谢你的邀请。

REGISTER: Standard English, highly common in both formal and informal contexts.
